FuncDef:
The set nd packet filter enable command enables invalid ND packet attack defense.
The undo set nd packet filter enable command disables invalid ND packet attack defense.
By default, invalid ND packet attack defense is not enabled.
CLIs: undo set nd packet filter enable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable invalid ND packet attack defense to filter out six types of invalid ND packets (NS, NA, RS, RA, Redirect, and CPS), run the set nd packet filter enable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
